page.title: 01OUR 4KM BY 3 KM BLOCK
page.content: Our 4km by 3km block forms part of the Greenbelt and farmland predominates the area of our 1985 Domesday Survey.Much of the land originally formed part of a Royal Hunting Ground,Enfield Chase,evidence remaining today. Crews Hill is an area of Nurseries and Garden Centres,and also boasts two Butterfly Centres,and Riding Stables. At the top of Clay Hill stands the Church of St John the Baptist,with St Johns Primary School close by.Along Strayfield Roads is the only factory in our area.The Fallow Buck Pub next to the church is one of three in our block.Crews Hill is the only Railway Station.Chase Farm Hospital is one of our amenities.The 313 Bus Service passes the hospital on its route along the Ridgeway.The M25 Motorway has made an impact on the rural landscape.
